meanings.definition: To improve or surpass in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: She bettered her painting skills by practicing every day.
meanings.sent2: The new chef bettered the taste of the dish with a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent3: The student bettered her grades and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His dedication bettered his chances of winning the competition.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight bettered the colors of the flowers, making them more vibrant.

meanings.definition: To become better or improve in condition.
meanings.sent1: With proper care, the plant bettered and grew taller.
meanings.sent2: After resting, his health bettered, and he felt stronger.
meanings.sent3: The old car bettered its performance after a tune-up.
meanings.sent4: Her mood bettered as she spent time with her friends.
meanings.sent5: The weather bettered, and the sky cleared up for a beautiful day.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in achievement.
meanings.sent1: He bettered his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team bettered their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent3: The magician bettered his trick and amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: She bettered her own expectations with a stunning performance.
meanings.sent5: The student bettered all others in the spelling bee competition.
